itemDescription: Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland

wikipedia_page.main: James Fraser McLuskey, MC (19 September 1914 – 24 July 2005) was a British Church of Scotland minister, who served as a military chaplain with the Special Air Service during World War II. He later went on to become the minister of St Columba's, the larger of the Church of Scotland's two congregations in London. He also served as Moderator of the General Assembly from 1983 to 1984.

response: ** Fraser McLuskey, Church of Scotland minister (born 1914)
*Fraser McLuskey, 90, Scottish military chaplain and minister.
